intro: Belangera cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, giving it its common name. Belangera cuneata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
